title: Walmart Gives Raises to More Than 565,000 Store Workers; Ahead of the holiday shopping season, Walmart is raising hourly pay at least $1 for many U.S. store workers as employers scramble for workers
text:
Those workers will receive at least a $1-an-hour raise starting Sept. 25, the company said in a memo to staff, bringing Walmart's overall average wage to $16.40 per hour. Store workers in some regions will continue to be paid $11 an hour, an hourly pay floor Walmart established in 2018.

Walmart, the country's largest retailer by revenue, has announced a series of wage increases and bonuses for staff in stores and warehouses since last year as competition for hourly workers intensifiesâ€”across a broad section of businesses from restaurants and retailers to amusement parks and warehouses.

Among retailers, competition is especially fierce ahead of the fall holiday shopping season when most retailers earn a significant percentage of their annual revenue.
